column1: Palm Beach Gardens is a city in Palm Beach County in the U.S. state of Florida
column2: 77 miles north of downtown Miami.  As of the 2010 United States Census
column4: 452. The city has a number of gated communities. Palm Beach Gardens is a principal city of the Miami metropolitan area
column5: which was home to an estimated 6 million people at the 2018 census.

column1: The city has a total area of 55.3 square miles (143 km2)
column2: of which 55.1 square miles (143 km2) is land and 0.2 square miles (0.52 km2) (4.5%) is water.
the land that became Palm Beach Gardens was primarily cattle ranches and pine forests

column6: 000 people. He chose the name Palm Beach Gardens after his initial choice
column8: was denied by the Florida Legislature
column9: because of the similarity of the name to the nearby Palm Beach. MacArthur planned to build a "garden city" so he altered the name slightly.  The city was incorporated as a "paper town" (meaning that it existed only on paper) in 1959. The 1960 Census recorded that the city officially had a population of one

column1: Rapid development took place in the 1960s. By 1970 the city had a population approaching 7
column2: 000 people. To showcase his new community
column3: MacArthur purchased an 80-year-old banyan tree located in nearby Lake Park
column4: that was to be cut down to enlarge a dentist's office. It cost $30
column6: 008 hours of manpower to move it. A second banyan was moved the following year. While moving the first banyan tree over the Florida East Coast Railway
column7: the massive tree shifted and disconnected the Western Union telephone and telegraph lines running adjacent to the railroad
column8: cutting off most communications between Miami
column10: and the outside world until the damage could be repaired.  These trees still remain at the center of MacArthur Boulevard near Northlake Boulevard and are still featured on the city shield. In January 2007

column1: City growth was slow but steady throughout the 1970s and 1980s

column9: 000 acres (20 km2) in the city by the John D. and Catherine T. MacArthur Foundation. Development of this property happened quickly and led to much new growth in the city.  The city adopted an Art in Public Places ordinance in 1989 and has amassed an eclectic collection of works.The city suffered much damage to its tropical landscaping in the hard freezes of 1985 and 1989
column10: but has experienced no freezing temperatures since then. The city was hit by Hurricane Frances
column12: and Hurricane Wilma in 2004 and 2005. Much of the city lost power for days at a time after each storm
column13: and many traffic signals and directional signs in the city were destroyed. Many homes and businesses were severely damaged during the first two storms and contractors and construction materials were at a premium. Hundreds of homes were only nearing final repair when Hurricane Wilma hit the following year damaging or destroying many of those completed or ongoing repairs.

column1: There are 12 golf courses within the city limits
column2: including a course owned by the municipality. The Professional Golfers' Association of America has its headquarters in the city.

column1: The Honda Classic has been held at two Palm Beach Gardens locations: from 2003 to 2006 at the Country Club at Mirasol and since 2007 at the PGA National Resort and Spa. Also
column2: the Senior PGA Championship was held at the current BallenIsles from 1964 to 1973
column3: and at the PGA National Golf Club from 1982 to 2000. PGA National was also the site of the 1983 Ryder Cup and the 1987 PGA Championship.

column2: the Palm Beach Gardens-based company FITTEAM concluded a 12-year deal with Major League Baseball′s Houston Astros and Washington Nationals giving it the naming rights to The Ballpark of the Palm Beaches – spring training home of the Astros and Nationals – in nearby West Palm Beach. The facility was renamed FITTEAM Ballpark of the Palm Beaches.

column1: The Palm Beach Gardens Police Department has 117 sworn officers. Its operational divisions include Road Patrol
column2: Traffic
column5: SWAT and Hostage Negotiation. The department also has an 85-member Volunteers in Police Service (VIPS) unit

column2: the chief of police is Stephen J. Stepp. Clinton Shannon and James Stormes are the Assistant Chiefs. There are four Police Majors. In 2016 a police officer was convicted for the killing of Corey Jones
column3: an African American man awaiting a tow truck after his vehicle broke down in Palm Beach Gardens.The Police Department provides protection to the city and also manages NorthComm - The North County Communications Center which handles emergency communications for the City of Palm Beach Gardens
column5: the Town of North Palm Beach
column6: the Town of Juno and the Town of Palm Beach Shores.  When someone calls 9-1-1 in one of these locations
column7: their call is routed to NorthComm and from there they notify the nearest available police unit.

column1: The Palm Beach Gardens Police Foundation is a non-profit foundation holding IRS 501(c)(3) status. The Mission of the Palm Beach Gardens Police Foundation is to secure private funding to enhance the integrity of the community and the effectiveness of the Police Department.  It does this by providing funding for innovative police department projects
column2: that would not otherwise be funded from the city's budget.

column1: The Palm Beach Gardens Fire Rescue Department operates out of five stations located throughout the City. As of October 2013
column2: the Fire Chief is Michael Southard.On September 11
column4: the city dedicated its "09.11.01 Memorial Plaza" at Fire Station 3 on Northlake Boulevard. The memorial commemorates the September 11
column5: 2001 attacks. Its centerpiece is a steel section retrieved from the ruins of the World Trade Center in New York City.

column1: The city charter provides for a council-manager government. The city council consists of five Palm Beach Gardens residents elected to serve three-year terms. A quorum of three members may conduct city business. The city manager is appointed by a majority vote of the council.

column2: the council appoints one of its members to be mayor
the last "missing link" of Interstate 95 (I-95) opened between PGA Boulevard in Palm Beach Gardens and State Road 714
column4: paving the way for new development immediately to the north. There are three interchanges on I-95 serving the city and a fourth at Central Boulevard is under consideration. The city also is served by two interchanges on Florida's Turnpike.

column1: Public transit is available to the rest of Palm Beach County through the regional commuter bus system PalmTran. In addition
column2: the South Florida Regional Transportation Authority has proposed extending the Tri-Rail commuter rail system northward with a proposed station near PGA Boulevard north of the current terminus at Mangonia Park. A trolley system is also proposed to serve the newly developed "Downtown" area.The nearest major airports
